question: How do I contact a commissioner, county team member or Girlguiding Hertfordshire volunteer?
answer:
Email addresses for commissioners and county lead volunteers email addresses can be found on the county website “[Your county team](/about-us/county-team/)” page located in the “About us” section.

Our members can contact the above plus other volunteers via the GO directory.

question: Who should I contact if I am having problems with GO?
How do I change the email address on my GO account?
answer:
Once logged into Go use the dropdown option with your name on in the right-hand to select the **profile** option.

It is important that you now use the **Lefthand side menu only***. **Select** the last option of **change email. Then** the **security** subheading.

***DO NOT USE THE EDIT OPTIONS ON THE RIGHT HAND SIDE OF THE PAGE**

Once on this screen you should follow the instructions in respect of entering your user password and then enter your new/correct email address.

question: What should I do if I have a safeguarding concern about a girl or a volunteer?
answer: Please contact the HQ safeguarding team as detailed in the [Girlguiding safeguarding procedure.](https://www.girlguiding.org.uk/information-for-volunteers/policies/safeguarding-policy/safeguarding-procedure/){:.external-link}{:rel="noopener"}{:target="_blank"}

question: How do I deal with a complaint as a volunteer?
answer: Details of how to deal with a complaint can be found in the [Girlguiding complaints procedure.](https://www.girlguiding.org.uk/information-for-volunteers/policies/complaints-policy/complaints-procedure/){:.external-link}{:rel="noopener"}{:target="_blank"}

question: Can my external first aid qualification be used to fulfil Girlguiding’s requirements?
answer: Check the [county website](/news/external-first-aid-courses/) for details on how to get your external first aid qualification added to your GO record.

question: How do I arrange for my daughter to move up to the next section?
answer: Please visit the [Get Involved](/get-involved/) page of the county website for details

question: Where can I find out about financial support available?
Who can help me with a subscription enquiry?
answer: Either your local commissioner or the county treasurer, <ctreasurer@girlguidinghertfordshire.org.uk>

question: What evidence can I provide a bank to prove charitable status?
answer: You should request a letter of charitable status from Girlguiding HQ <certcharitablestatus@girlguiding.org.uk>. You should make sure the letter refers to the bank account’s name.

question: Where can I find out about county events and training opportunities?
answer:
Please refer to the [Events page](/events/) and [Training page](/training/) of the county website.

Details of training courses are also contained within the monthly Essential News enewsletter emailed to all members aged 14+.

Information about events is included within the monthly Billboard enewsletter, emailed to members aged 14+ who have opted into receiving marketing via the marketing preferences within GO.

question: How do I sign up to receive the county Billboard enewsletter?
How do I order Bronze, Silver and Gold award badges and certificates?
What items does county have that I can borrow for my recruitment event
answer: You can find a list of items you can borrow on the county website’s [Resources page](/about-us/resources/)

question: I have an opportunity for Girlguiding members, who do I contact with a request to advertise it to your members?
answer: <admin@girlguidinghertfordshire.org.uk>.  If suitable, it will be shared via the Noticeboard webpage or within the monthly Billboard e-newsletter sent to members opted into receiving marketing

question: How do I organise a 1st response course for my division/district?
answer: The process to follow to arrange a 1st response course can be found on the [county website.](/news/organising-1st-response-courses/)

question: What items does county have that I can borrow for my recruitment event?
answer: If you wish to find our what items are available to borrow and arrange hire please email <volunteer@girlguidinghertfordshire.org.uk>

question: How can I obtain an update from the unit my daughter is on the waiting list to join?
answer:
In the first instance, log in to the Girlguiding GO membership system, click on the drop down arrow on the top right of the screen, next to the profile icon, and select 'My Daughters'. 

Within the 'My Daughters' section you will see your daughter's name and the unit she is registered with. Click on the black arrow under the 'Actions' column and select 'Message her unit' from the drop down list. 

You will then be able to send a message to the unit directly.
